timeline.bodyText: This λ/Δλ stuff seems unrelated to #6896. @JayanthyChengan do you mean for this to be in the pull request?
timeline.author: pdurbin
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -31,7 +31,7 @@ datasetfieldtype.astroFacility.description=The observatory or facility where the
 datasetfieldtype.astroInstrument.description=The instrument used to collect the data.
 datasetfieldtype.astroObject.description=Astronomical Objects represented in the data (Given as SIMBAD recognizable names preferred).
 datasetfieldtype.resolution.Spatial.description=The spatial (angular) resolution that is typical of the observations, in decimal degrees.
-datasetfieldtype.resolution.Spectral.description=The spectral resolution that is typical of the observations, given as the ratio λ/Δλ.
+datasetfieldtype.resolution.Spectral.description=The spectral resolution that is typical of the observations, given as the ratio \u03bb/\u0394\u03bb.

replies.bodyText: It's related to GlobalDataverseCommunityConsortium/dataverse-language-packs#65.  Thought of adding to this PR.
replies.author: JayanthyChengan

replies.bodyText: @JayanthyChengan thanks. @jggautier and I took a look at the demo server and you're right, this absolutely should be fixed! I'm putting a screenshot below for QA. Should it be fixed in astrophysics.tsv as well?
replies.author: pdurbin

timeline.bodyText: @JayanthyChengan this looks fine but do you have any insight into the fact that the longer version appears above  while the shorter version appears below? Is this by design? Here's a screenshot:
timeline.author: pdurbin
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -106,7 +106,7 @@ datasetfieldtype.topicClassification.description=The classification field indica
 datasetfieldtype.topicClassValue.description=Topic or Subject term that is relevant to this Dataset.
 datasetfieldtype.topicClassVocab.description=Provided for specification of the controlled vocabulary in use, e.g., LCSH, MeSH, etc.
 datasetfieldtype.topicClassVocabURI.description=Specifies the URL location for the full controlled vocabulary.
-datasetfieldtype.publication.description=Publications that use the data from this Dataset.
+datasetfieldtype.publication.description=Publications that use the data from this Dataset. The full list of Related Publications will be displayed on the metadata tab.

replies.bodyText: @pdurbin :  Thanks for the screenshots.  corrected both issues and pushed the code.  Please verify
replies.author: JayanthyChengan

replies.bodyText: @JayanthyChengan this looks good but there should be a release note. Please take a look at scholarsportal#75 and merge it if you think it looks ok.
replies.author: pdurbin

replies.bodyText: @JayanthyChengan thanks! From your experience, do you think it's necessary to maintain "description" in both the TSV files and the properties files? I hope not because this seems like a maintenance burden. If so I think we should try to move completely to the properties files.
replies.author: pdurbin
JayanthyChengan

replies.bodyText: @JayanthyChengan no problem. Thanks for your response and this pull request! Have a great weekend!
replies.author: pdurbin

timeline.message: datasetRelatedPublication title and description are fetched from Resource Bundle files.

add release note #6896
datasetRelatedPublication title and description are fetched from Resource Bundle files.
